oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Long boy
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Soldiers; Marching; Farms; Mules; Dogs; Swine; Roosters; Arrivals & departures; Families; Farewells; World War, 1914-1918
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Comical drawing in which a soldier with rifle on his shoulder marches off to World War I down a dirt road and leaves in the background mother, father, sweetheart, a dog, and a mule sticking its head out of a barn. American flags are being waved by those; left behind, and a pig and a rooster are also visible. Subtitle on cover reads "Goodbye Ma! Goodbye Pa! Goodbye, Mule with yer old Hee-Haw!"
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Wiliams, Gaar, 1880-1935
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Kenneth D. Rose Sheet Music Collection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Words by William Herschell; music by Barclay Walker. Song lyrics deal with a tall, thin young man enlisting for World War I.
